articles.description: Where does England's shambolic defeat against Greece at Wemble leave interim manager Lee Carsley?

articles.description: England's record-breaking runscoring is testament to their incredible spirit, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt
articles.title: Pakistan v England: 'Records are made to be broken, spirit is made to last'

articles.description: BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller on Rafael Nadal's enduring rivalry with Roger Federer and his legacy in the tennis world.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal retiring: Reflections on 'the son every mum would love to have'

articles.description: Rafael Nadal is described as a "legend" and "one of the greatest of all time" after the tennis icon confirms he will retire at the end of this season.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer lead tributes after retirement announcement

articles.description: Greece and England will mark George Baldock's death during their Nations League match at Wembley.

articles.description: Republic of Ireland manager Heimir Hallgrimsson says Thursday's dramatic win over Finland can boost the confidence of his side.

articles.description: England start with a false nine experiment, end up in a rudimentary 4-4-2 shape, and lose to Greece on a damaging night for Lee Carsley's job prospects.
articles.title: England: What next for Lee Carsley as false nine Greece experiment fails?

articles.description: West Indies star with the bat as they boost their T20 World Cup semi-final hopes with a clinical eight-wicket win over Bangladesh.
articles.title: Women's T20 World Cup: West Indies cruise to win over Bangladesh

articles.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland breaks Norway's all-time goals record at the age of 24 in their Nations League win over Slovenia.
articles.title: Norway 3-0 Slovenia: Erling Haaland breaks goals record in win

articles.description: Batter Harry Brook says he and Joe Root "didn't know" the long-standing England partnership record they broke during an astonishing fourth day of the first Test against Pakistan.
articles.title: England vs Pakistan: Harry Brook and Joe Root did not know records they were breaking
